turinginterpreter

Class Tape

  • java.lang.Object
    • turinginterpreter.Tape

  • public class Tape
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tape(int initialLength)
      Create new Tape object with given initial size and head position in the middle of the list.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tape

        public Tape(int initialLength)
        Create new Tape object with given initial size and head position in the middle of the list.
        Parameters:
        initialLength - The size for the tape to begin with. Note that all tapes are functionally infinite, this is only to save computational time. If initialLength is negative or less than 3, use 10 (standard) instead to avoid provoking errors further down the line. (This program assumes there is always at least one cell on either side of the head.)

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentCell

        public java.lang.Character getCurrentCell()

      • executeStep

        public void executeStep(char character,
                        char direction)
        Sets the current cell to arg character and moves head in direction of arg direction. See doc of setCurrentCell and moveHead for details.
        Parameters:
        character - The character to insert at this space.
        direction - The direction for the head to move.

      • getSectionOfTapeAsString

        public java.lang.String getSectionOfTapeAsString(int range)
        Reads a section of (range) characters to either side of the head and returns it as a string. If there is not enough space on the tape to go in the given distance, extends the tape.
        Parameters:
        range - How many chars to go to either side.
        Returns:
        The assembled string.

      • getEntireTapeAsString

        public java.lang.String getEntireTapeAsString()
        Plonks the entire tape into a string and returns it.
        Returns:
        The tape's content as a string. Note this will inevitably contain EMPTY_CELL_CHARs (' '), so handle those.

      • writeCharArrayToTapeUnderHead

        public void writeCharArrayToTapeUnderHead(char[] array)
        Starting at the current head position and proceeding right, write the content of the given array to the tape.
        Parameters:
        array - The char array (usually a converted String) to be written.

      • writeBinaryIntToTapeUnderHead

        public void writeBinaryIntToTapeUnderHead(int integer)
        Convert a given integer to binary form and write it to the tape, starting under the head's current position and moving right.
        Parameters:
        integer - The integer to be written.

      • writeUnaryIntToTapeUnderHead

        public void writeUnaryIntToTapeUnderHead(int integer)
        Convert a given integer to unary form and write it to the tape, starting under the head's current position and moving right.
        Parameters:
        integer - The integer to be written.
